intro: Sinojackia microcarpa, commonly known as the Chinese sand pear, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its pinnately compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates. The botanical features of Sinojackia microcarpa make it an important plant in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
